page.title: 03RE-USE SKELMORLIE MANSIONS
page.content: Only two small hotels remain now- adays but the convalescent homes and holiday centres remain.So once again people come from the cities to spend a summer holiday in Skelmorlie. Stroove House belongs to the Church of Scotland and each summer a group of mothers and children from Northern Ireland come to escape from the worry and tension of the present troubles there. Families from deprived areas of Glasgow also spend the summer here. Youth groups,old people and many others enjoy a holiday in this quiet but friendly village. Other centres run by the Salvation Army,Steel Worker's Benevolent Fund and the Miner's Welfare Fund provide facilities for all ages to enjoy a much needed rest in tranquil surroundings.
